Package edu.waketech.academic

Class Assignment

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.waketech.academic.Assignment
  • public class Assignment
extends java.lang.Object
    An assignment (such as a lab, test, flogging, etc) for a particular student.

    An assignment consists of a name, the total possible points of the assignment, and the score the associated student achieved on this assignment

    Assignments are associated with a particular student implicitly. See Course.

    Author:
    parks

    • Constructor Detail

      • Assignment

        public Assignment​(java.lang.String name,
                  int possiblePoints,
                  int score)
        Constructor with assignment name, the total number of points possible, and the actual number of points earned. Note that if name is null or the empty String, an IllegalArgumentException is thrown. If possiblePoints is negative, an IllegalArgumentException is thrown.
        Parameters:
        name - of the assignment. A null value or empty name will cause an IllegalArgumentException to be thrown.
        possiblePoints - the maximum points available for the assignment. Must be non-negative. A negative value will cause an IllegalArgumentException to be thrown.
        score - the student's actual score on this assignment

    • Method Detail

      • isNamed

        public boolean isNamed​(java.lang.String name)
        Test if this Assignment has the given name
        Parameters:
        name - the name to be tested
        Returns:
        true if this Assignment's name equals the parameter, false otherwise.

      • getScorePercent

        public int getScorePercent()
        The score expressed as a percentage of the possiblePoints. The percentage is rounded.
        Returns:
        percentage of score divided by possiblePoints.

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()

        Returns:
        the possiblePoints

      • setPossiblePoints

        public void setPossiblePoints​(int possiblePoints)
        Setter for the possible points of this assignment. Assignments must have non-negative possible points. A negative value for the parameter will cause an IllegalArgumentException to be thrown.
        Parameters:
        possiblePoints - the possiblePoints to set, must be >= 0

      • getScore

        The score achieved by the associated student on this assignment
        Returns:
        the Assignment's score
